metadata.dc:author: González, E
Montenegro, M A
Lemus, D
Blánquez, M J
Rojas, M A
metadata.dc:description: In this study we examined some histologic and histochemical characteristics of the embryonic sheep dental epithelium in early odontogenesis. During the first trimester of development, a short-lived dental lamina was observed. Apparently in the sheep, the interactions between epithelial and ectomesenchymal cells required for tooth normal morphogenesis are altered.
metadata.dc:title: Involución de germenes dentarios en la oveja (Ovis aries).
[Involution of the tooth germ in sheep (Ovis aries)].
